title: Question 5

children: A 69-year-old woman is evaluated during a wellness visit. The average of three blood pressure measurements is 150/80 mm Hg.
Which of the following is most compatible with the funduscopic findings shown?
Hypertensive retinopathy is most compatible with the funduscopic findings shown. This funduscopic examination

) characteristic of hypertensive retinopathy. The degree of retinal arterial narrowing is assessed by comparing arteriolar diameter relative to retinal venule diameter (arteriole-to-venule ratio); venule diameters do not vary substantially in most patients with hypertension. An arteriole-to-venule ratio less than 1 suggests relative arteriolar narrowing; this patient's arteriole-to-venule ratio is 0.63. Arteriolar narrowing is a predictor of future development of hypertension and increased risk for stroke. Evidence also indicates that arteriolar narrowing is associated with coronary artery disease and kidney damage.

figureCredits: Images reproduced with permission from Wong TY, Klein R, Sharrett AR, et al; Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities Study. Retinal arteriolar diameter and risk for hypertension.
